programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve must deal with bad weather and fierce competition during a late-season central Montana elk hunt. With some tips from a friend, Steve encounters plenty of elk on this public land hunt. But he'll have to hike hard in steep country and deep snow to get to the elk and away from other hunters.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan, a British Columbia guide, hike into the steep backcountry of northern British Columbia in search of grizzlies and black bears. Among the beutiful alpine vista, this adventure includes some intense and up-close bear action ‚Äì almost too close.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan, a British Columbia guide, hike into the steep backcountry of northern British Columbia in search of grizzlies and black bears. Among the beutiful alpine vista, this adventure includes some intense and up-close bear action ‚Äì almost too close.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his buddy Doug Duren give comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen their first taste of Midwest deer hunting culture by sitting in freezing ground blinds on opening day in Wisconsin. It just wouldn't be a trip to the Duren Family Farm without a little trapping and duck hunting thrown in, rounding out the larder for a big wild game feast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his buddy Doug Duren give comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen their first taste of Midwest deer hunting culture by sitting in freezing ground blinds on opening day in Wisconsin. It just wouldn't be a trip to the Duren Family Farm without a little trapping and duck hunting thrown in, rounding out the larder for a big wild game feast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his friend and wild turkey specialist, Robert Abernathy, head to southern Florida to hunt Osceola gobblers. Steve hopes to finish off his Royal Turkey Slam, achieved by bagging all five subspecies of the American wild turkey‚Äîa quest that‚Äôs been a decade in the making. These two turkey hunting fanatics celebrate with a delicious meal of grilled and stuff wild wild turkey breast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella is invited by the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation for a special opportunity to hunt elk during the rut in the mountainous coal country of southeastern Kentucky, a place where his hero Daniel Boone once roamed. This is Steve‚Äôs first eastern elk hunt, and he quickly realizes that the rules of the game here are different. If he manages to track one down, he‚Äôll prepare what was supposedly Boone‚Äôs favorite meal: elk liver.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Join Steve on this Cooking Special as he dives into the best of Alaskan seafood, featuring shrimp, crab, fish, and clams. Learn how to make easy, delicious seafood recipes that showcase the fresh flavors of the sea. Whether you're a seasoned cook or a beginner, Steve's simple steps will help you prepare mouthwatering dishes that capture the essence of Alaskan waters.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve's annual quest for a giant mule deer buck continues this year in southwest Colorado. Here, Steve fills us in on his favorite critter, the mule deer. As he hunts will share his vast knowledge about these special western game animals including how to hunt, butcher, and most importantly how cook them-if he can put his tag on one.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella scratches his spring turkey itch this year as he visits Southeast Wisconsin to call in some big eastern Toms with his buddy Jerod Fink. The guys also plan to do some bow fishing after dark so they can enjoy a real Midwest turkey and fish fry.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, but is often overlooked by wild game cooks at home. Following a series of successful hunts across North America this past fall, Steve demonstrates how to cook a variety of breakfast classics using wild game ingredients‚Äîincluding black bear bacon, which Steve has never tried before.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: After four years of waiting, Steven Rinella draws a coveted, limited-entry public land bull elk tag for New Mexico‚Äôs Gila National Forest. Steve heads into the backcountry on a solo backpack hunt where his biggest challenge is the vast expanse of hills covered in thick timber. This demanding hunt requires lots of glassing and even more hiking. Here, even just one missed opportunity could result in an empty freezer.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: While it‚Äôs considered a long-standing hunting tradition to eat the heart of your first kill, the heart is otherwise often underutilized in a wild game chef‚Äôs repertoire. Using the hearts from a wild boar, mule deer, caribou, moose and elk, Steve shares five of his favorite methods of preparing this underappreciated, nutrient-rich muscle.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella will take Navy SEAL Rorke Denver on his first hunt deep into the Alaskan backcountry to search for black bears in the mighty Alaska Range. In the remote wilderness, two friends will look into the differences and similarities between the hunter and the warrior. The bears are out but Rorke and Steve will have to work hard to put a tag on one.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella will take Navy SEAL Rorke Denver on his first hunt deep into the Alaskan backcountry to search for black bears in the mighty Alaska Range. In the remote wilderness, two friends will look into the differences and similarities between the hunter and the warrior. The bears are out but Rorke and Steve will have to work hard to put a tag on one.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Dropped off by bushplane on a remote lakeside in the wilderness of Alaska‚Äôs Brooks Range, Steven Rinella and wildlife biologist Brandt Meixell have ten days of hunting before the plane returns. Big-antlered Yukon moose are few and far between but hard work pays off for hunters who stick with it until the bitter end.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Dropped off by bushplane on a remote lakeside in the wilderness of Alaska‚Äôs Brooks Range, Steven Rinella and wildlife biologist Brandt Meixell have ten days of hunting before the plane returns. programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella has hunted this area before, but he feels he‚Äôs just scratched the surface exploring the surrounding country. The top of the mountain is always calling Steve‚Äôs name, and for this serious Alaskan backpack hunt he‚Äôs bringing along comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen. Cold, wet weather and tough hunting for wily Sitka deer make this a southeast Alaskan adventure these hunters will never forget.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: As the prime cuts are often the first to go, most families are left with a freezer brimming with ground wild game meat. Pulled from the pages of his forthcoming Wild Game Cookbook, Steve shares a variety of recipes from burger to meatloaf and more ‚Äì designed to whittle down this supply and jazz up your ground meat game.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve is fascinated by indigenous people who live in the wilds South America. In this three-part series, he travels deep into the Amazon jungle to hunt with and learn from the locals there. Not only will this be one heck of a hunting adventure, it will be a mind-opening, life-changing event. From bowfishing to hunting in the jungle at night, you never know what the evening‚Äôs menu will bring.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 2/28/2021. Stanley Tucci explores Bologna, seen by many as the food capital of Italy. The region of Emilia-Romagna is home to globally renowned protected food products: parmigiano, prosciutto de Parma and traditional balsamic vinegar to name a few.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 3/7/2021. Stanley Tucci eats and drinks his way around Milan. Here, Stanley enjoys an aperitivo, feels inspired to make pizzoccheri – a noodle made from buckwheat, and enjoys classic Milanese – veal chops and risotto.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 3/14/2021. Stanley Tucci explores his former home: Tuscany. Stanley does a wine bar crawl, celebrates the importance of the lowly loaf and samples dishes which use stale bread as the key ingredient.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 3/21/2021. Stanley Tucci visits Sicily. Here, Stanley tries a salty crunchy sensation, tastes the grapes grown in the region's unique soils, and reflects on Sicilian hospitality.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 2/14/2021. Stanley Tucci feasts on pizza in Naples. Stanley embarks on a whirlwind tour to find the freshest mozzarella and the best San Marzano tomatoes, and enjoys a spectacular spaghetti and zucchini.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 2/21/2021. Stanley Tucci heads to Rome in search of the famous Four Pastas. Stanley orders rigatoni all’amatriciana, samples carbonara and tries a selection of cheeses and sausages made from the sheep and pigs farmed in the region.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 5/1/2016. Anthony Bourdain visits the iconic Old Town Ale House, eats mapo tofu in Chinatown and shares a home-cooked meal with rapper Lupe Fiasco.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 5/8/2016. On the island of Naxos, Anthony Bourdain dives to a sunken shipwreck, drinks raki with locals and samples cuisine fresh off a fishing boat.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.
